Description: Upper body of a small spheroidal vase of pink marl clay pottery, with two small tubular handles at the shoulders, and flat everted rim. Exterior decorated in red paint with a series of horizontal wavy lines interrupted by a row of s-motifs just above the maximum diameter. Base and part of side missing.
Curator's comments: Similar to Decorated ware D9g in Petrie’s Corpus of Prehistoric Pottery (1921).
